dataElement.name: useQuotesInSql
dataElement.label: Use quotes in sql
dataElement.businessDescription: Not used any more. This was created to handle certain naming convention related issue wth postgre sql in a specific project.

dataElement.name: cachePaginationDataOnClient
dataElement.label: Cache pagination on client
dataElement.businessDescription: Not used any more. Pagination by default is to happen on the client. This is definitely not a good practice, and hence we do not want to give such an option any more.

dataElement.name: loggedInUserDataTypeIsInteger
dataElement.label: User id is integer
dataElement.businessDescription: Exility needs to handle userId and it assumes it to be text by default. Override it here. We intend to get this from data dictioanry in the future.

dataElement.name: systemDateFunction
dataElement.label: System date function
dataElement.businessDescription: function to be used to get system date in a sql. This is used by the database utility to get current date. In the future, we intend to populate this based on the selected rdbms system (like if postgre is used this should be set to CURRENT_DATE )

dataElement.name: definitionsToBeCached
dataElement.label: Cache xmls?
dataElement.businessDescription: to be set to true in produciton, and false during development. When false, every resourece is loaded from disk each time, there by ensuring that the latest resource as saved the devloper is executed. However, in production we cache these to avoid over head of repeated reads from disk. we intend to move this parameter to web.xml, so that deployments are smoother.

dataElement.name: cachePrimaryKeys
dataElement.label: Cache primary keys?
dataElement.businessDescription: Not used any more because of the possibel damaze when not set properly. If there is always exactly one server aplication that is running, primary keys canbe cached, there by improving performance of key generation. However, if peopel forget to set this properly in a muti-server environment, this will lead to duplicate primary key generation.

dataElement.name: trace
dataElement.label: Produce trace?
dataElement.businessDescription: Whether server should sent trace data to client. True during development, and possible debugging. false in produciton to improve performance. we will move this to web.xml

dataElement.name: securityEnabled
dataElement.label: Enable security?
dataElement.businessDescription: not used any more due to security threat in case somme one forgets this. We have provided single-signon utility to take care of login issues during testing

dataElement.name: useNullForEmptyString
dataElement.label: NULL for empty string?
dataElement.businessDescription: Oracle has issue with storing empty string as valid value in varchar field. It treats it as null. If you set this to true, exility uses NULL instead of empty string as value of a empty text field while generating sqls at run time.

dataElement.name: uniqueNamesAcrossGroups
dataElement.label: Data elements unique across groups?
dataElement.businessDescription: Object oriented approach assumes context of an object for every attribute, and hence people get used to attributes like name, rather than customerName. Exility tried to accomodate both convention by allowing just name as attribute, but insisting on qualifying that always with group. This has not gone well, and hence we just do not allow that any more.

dataElement.name: licenceValidation
dataElement.label: Licensed Instance?
dataElement.businessDescription: discontinued. licencing utilities are decoupled from exility.

dataElement.name: enableAuditForAll
dataElement.label: Audit all tables?
dataElement.businessDescription: by default all database modifications using tabel utitlities will be logged to audit tables as well. Not desirable. You should be selective in writing audit trials using toBAudited attribute at the table level

dataElement.name: isSeparateAuditSchema
dataElement.label: Separate schema for audit?
dataElement.businessDescription: It is a good practice to use separate schema for audit tables.

dataElement.name: alignPanels
dataElement.label: Align panels?
dataElement.businessDescription: Not used any more. Used for formatting page in a certain way for a specific project

dataElement.name: httpNoCacheTagRequires
dataElement.label: Http no-cache for page?
dataElement.businessDescription: Not used any more. This should be handled in web server setting.

dataElement.name: spanForButtonPanelRequires
dataElement.label: Span for button panel?
dataElement.businessDescription: not used any more. Page generation issue for a specific project

dataElement.name: showRequiredLabelinGrid
dataElement.label: * for grid column?
dataElement.businessDescription: not used any more. Page generation issue for a specific project

dataElement.name: assumeTextForMissingDataElement
dataElement.label: Live with undefined elemens?
dataElement.businessDescription: Not recommended. Temporarary arrangement in a project to take care of some mass change issues.

dataElement.name: showIamgeForDeleteOption
dataElement.label: Show delete image?
dataElement.businessDescription: How delete row has to be handled in a grid. It can be either an image or we generate a simple check box.

dataElement.name: showDeleteOptionAtEnd
dataElement.label: Common delete at end?
dataElement.businessDescription: not used any more. Page generation issue for a specific project

dataElement.name: lastKeyEventTrigger
dataElement.label: Auto add-row on tab key?
dataElement.businessDescription: whether a new row has to be added automatically when user presses tab button on the last field. Like in a word processor

dataElement.name: auditConnectionString
dataElement.label: Audit connection string
dataElement.businessDescription: not recommended. use data source instead.

dataElement.name: globalServerDataNames
dataElement.label: Global fields
dataElement.businessDescription: fields that are required across all services for a logged in session. These fields are cached into session after a login service. This means that the login service should get values for these fields. This approach is to be used instead of setCookies attribute.

dataElement.name: loginServiceId
dataElement.label: Login service name
dataElement.businessDescription: server needs to allow logi service to go thru without authentication

dataElement.name: logoutServiceId
dataElement.label: Logout service name
dataElement.businessDescription: server will remove all session related cached data once this servise is executed.

dataElement.name: commonPrimaryKeyColumnName
dataElement.label: Default primary keycolumn name
dataElement.businessDescription: like id. Not used anymore though.

dataElement.name: imageFilePrefix
dataElement.label: Image file prefix
dataElement.businessDescription: Used by generator to set src attribute for img tag. Should be the path of the image folder relative to a page.html e.g. ../../images/exilityImages

dataElement.name: commonFolderPrefix
dataElement.label: Common folder prefix
dataElement.businessDescription: not used any more. Used by page generater to include default.css and other common fiels to be included in all pages.

dataElement.name: exilityFolderPrefix
dataElement.label: Exility folder prefix
dataElement.businessDescription: not used any more. Used by page generater to include standard exility scripts.

dataElement.name: pageLayoutType
dataElement.label: Page layout type
dataElement.businessDescription: Determines the conventions for page gernator. css is the new standard, and all other values are only for existing projects

dataElement.name: paginateButtonType
dataElement.label: Pagination button type
dataElement.businessDescription: when exility is handling pagination, how should the buttons for navigations be managed? We have created copule of variants. Please come back with more if you need.

dataElement.name: setCookies
dataElement.label: Cookie names
dataElement.businessDescription: Should not be used. cookies are visible to clients and subject to misuse. Use global fields instead.

dataElement.name: fileUploadMeans
dataElement.label: File upload means
dataElement.businessDescription: Not used sny more

dataElement.name: projectName
dataElement.label: Project name
dataElement.businessDescription: For documentaion. Not used, except for celebrus! Page gernator has a hard coded logic for that!

dataElement.name: dateFormattingPrefix
dataElement.label: Date formatting prefix
dataElement.businessDescription: How to format date constants. use prefix and postfix as per dbms being used. we intend to do this automatically in the future, ut as of now you should be carefu in setting this.

dataElement.name: dateFormattingPostfix
dataElement.label: Date formatting postfix
dataElement.businessDescription: How to format date constants. use prefix and postfix as per dbms being used. we intend to do this automatically in the future, ut as of now you should be carefu in setting this.

dataElement.name: dateTimeFormattingPrefix
dataElement.label: Date and time formatting prefix
dataElement.businessDescription: How to format date-tme constants. use prefix and postfix as per dbms being used. we intend to do this automatically in the future, ut as of now you should be carefu in setting this.

dataElement.name: dateTimeFormattingPostfix
dataElement.label: Date and formatting postfix
dataElement.businessDescription: How to format date-tme constants. use prefix and postfix as per dbms being used. we intend to do this automatically in the future, ut as of now you should be carefu in setting this.

dataElement.name: loggedInUserFieldName
dataElement.label: Fieldname for loggedin user
dataElement.businessDescription: this is autmatically used as the value for logging and other contexts

dataElement.name: dbDriver
dataElement.label: Database driver
dataElement.businessDescription: like oracle, posgre, or sqlServer

dataElement.name: dataElementSeparator
dataElement.label: Data element separator
dataElement.businessDescription: If we choose to have names not unique across groups, we use groupName+this separator+element name as qualified name.

dataElement.name: defaultPageHeight
dataElement.label: Default page height
dataElement.businessDescription: page height to be used for generated pages. Not used in css mode.

dataElement.name: defaultPageWidth
dataElement.label: Default page width
dataElement.businessDescription: page width to be used for generated pages. Not used in css mode.

dataElement.name: defaultPaginationSize
dataElement.label: Number of rows per pagination
dataElement.businessDescription: If you provide this number, all list panels, by default, will be paginated with these many rows per page.

dataElement.name: filePath
dataElement.label: Path for uploading files
dataElement.businessDescription: folder path from web root where all uploaded files are saved.

dataElement.name: cleanserName
dataElement.label: Cleanser name
dataElement.businessDescription: cleanser is the java code that is called before and after invoking every resource.

dataElement.name: excelFilePath
dataElement.label: Path for excel files
dataElement.businessDescription: folder path from web root where all xl files are saved.

dataElement.name: ExcelTemplatesPath
dataElement.label: Path for excel templates
dataElement.businessDescription: folder path from web root where all xl report templates are available.

dataElement.name: excelReportFileSavePath
dataElement.label: Path for excel reports
dataElement.businessDescription: folder path from web root where all xl reports are to be saved.

dataElement.name: eMailFromUserId
dataElement.label: Email userid
dataElement.businessDescription: exility uses a fairly primitive email utility. You are encouraged to ask for more. This is the user id to be used to login to the mail server

dataElement.name: eMailFromPassword
dataElement.label: Email password
dataElement.businessDescription: exility uses a fairly primitive email utility. You are encouraged to ask for more. This is the password to be used to login to mail server

dataElement.name: eMailBody
dataElement.label: Email pody
dataElement.businessDescription: exility uses a fairly primitive email utility. You are encouraged to ask for more. This is body of the mail to be sent

dataElement.name: eMailHost
dataElement.label: Email host
dataElement.businessDescription: exility uses a fairly primitive email utility. You are encouraged to ask for more. This is the host name

dataElement.name: eMailPort
dataElement.label: Email port
dataElement.businessDescription: exility uses a fairly primitive email utility. You are encouraged to ask for more. This is the port

dataElement.name: cleanserNameSpace
dataElement.label: Cleanser namespace
dataElement.businessDescription: cleanser is the java code that is called before and after invoking every resource.

dataElement.name: cleanserAssemblyName
dataElement.label: Cleanser assembly name
dataElement.businessDescription: cleanser is the java code that is called before and after invoking every resource.

dataElement.name: commandTimeOutTime
dataElement.label: SQL command timeout
dataElement.businessDescription: Use this to change the default time out set for the database instance. exility issues this commend to a connection session.

dataElement.name: audittableSuffix
dataElement.label: Audit table suffix
dataElement.businessDescription: suffix to be used to the table name to get the name of table that is used as audit table. example you may use customer_audit for customer, in which case suffux would be _audit

dataElement.name: htmlRootRelativeToResourcePath
dataElement.label: Relative path of html from root
dataElement.businessDescription: Page generator uses this path to save generated htmls

dataElement.name: connectionString
dataElement.label: Database connection string
dataElement.businessDescription: discouraged. use data source instead.

dataElement.name: batchConnectionString
dataElement.label: Connection string for batch
dataElement.businessDescription: discouraged. use data source instead.

dataElement.name: generateColTags
dataElement.label: Generate COL tags for table
dataElement.businessDescription: Defaults to true in pagetype css. earlier versions can make use of col tags for table so that the columns can be styled thru css.

dataElement.name: okToSave
dataElement.businessDescription: Whether the parameters can be saved
dataElement.label: OK to Save

dataElement.name: starForRequiredField
dataElement.label: Where do we put * for mandatory field?
dataElement.businessDescription: Not recommended. Should be handled thru css. none, before and after are options.

dataElement.name: quietResetAction
dataElement.label: No need to warn when reset button is clicked
dataElement.businessDescription: Not recommended. Exility tracks changes to pages, and warns if user is leavinig page without saving. This can be controlled thru attribues at page level as well as at field level. However a project wanted this short cut.

dataElement.name: nlsDateFormat
dataElement.label: Oracle nls_dateformat
dataElement.businessDescription: If you are using oracle data base, you must ensure that the default date format is yyyy-mm-dd. If the blobal setting is different from this, use this attribute to change it for the connection session

dataElement.name: dataSource
dataElement.label: Datasource for db connection
dataElement.businessDescription: preferred way of managing database connection, instead of connection string

dataElement.name: auditdataSource
dataElement.label: Datasource for audit
dataElement.businessDescription: preferred way of managing database connection, instead of connection string

dataElement.name: getCookies
dataElement.label: Cookies to be extracted
dataElement.businessDescription: not used any more. cookies are subjetc to client side manipulation. use globalServerDataNames instead.

dataElement.name: formatter
dataElement.label: Formatter
dataElement.businessDescription: Used by client side to format the value while rendering in output-only mode. Like commas in amounts. Name of the formatter mentioned here has to be impkemented on the client side as function.

dataElement.name: sqlType
dataElement.label: SQL Data Type
dataElement.businessDescription: If this data element is to be included in a script like create table, what would be the sql type. This must be validated by rdbms adminsistrator

dataElement.name: regex
dataElement.label: Regex
dataElement.businessDescription: Regular expression that this value has to conform to.

dataElement.name: minLength
dataElement.label: Min length
dataElement.businessDescription: minmum number of characters expected

dataElement.name: maxLength
dataElement.label: Max length
dataElement.businessDescription: maximum number of characters allowed

dataElement.name: minValue
dataElement.label: Min value
dataElement.businessDescription: minimum expected value

dataElement.name: maxValue
dataElement.label: Max value
dataElement.businessDescription: maximum allowed value

dataElement.name: allowNegativeValue
dataElement.label: Allow negative?
dataElement.businessDescription: can the number be negative?

dataElement.name: numberOfDecimals
dataElement.label: Nbr fracitonal digits
dataElement.businessDescription: how many fractional digits are required for this number?

dataElement.name: maxDaysBeforeToday
dataElement.label: Max days into past
dataElement.businessDescription: how many days into the past from today can this value go back to? to put a min date in the future, use negative number as the value here

dataElement.name: maxDaysAfterToday
dataElement.label: Max days into future
dataElement.businessDescription: how many days from today can this date go into the future? to put a max date in the past, use negative number as the value here

dataElement.name: includesTime
dataElement.label: Includes time?
dataElement.businessDescription: Does this field require tracking actual time also. If this is no, then time part is saved as 0 for date, so that teh dates match on comparison

dataElement.name: trueValue
dataElement.label: Text when true
dataElement.businessDescription: What is the value of this field, as seen by users when internal value is true

dataElement.name: falseValue
dataElement.label: Text when false
dataElement.businessDescription: what is the value as seen by users when in ternal value is false

dataElement.name: baseDataType
dataElement.label: Base data type
dataElement.businessDescription: List data type typically woudl be a list of another field value. Use the data type of that field as base data type, so that the entries can be validated agains that data type

dataElement.name: minCount
dataElement.label: Min counte
dataElement.businessDescription: minimum number of entries exoected in th elist

dataElement.name: maxCount
dataElement.label: Max count
dataElement.businessDescription: maximum number of expected entries. Come one. Don't tell us it is unlimited. Always put a practical limit to avoid programming exceotions.

dataElement.name: name
dataElement.label: Name
dataElement.businessDescription: Commonly used for various attributes

dataElement.name: messageName
dataElement.label: Message Name
dataElement.businessDescription: Used to show message on th eclient. Must be defined in messages.xml

dataElement.name: language
dataElement.label: Language
dataElement.businessDescription: Different languages in which this applicaiton is accessible

dataGroup.name: internal
dataGroup.label: Internal
dataGroup.businessDescription: Used internally by the project. No meaning to business

dataElement.name: inactive
dataElement.label: Is Active?
dataElement.businessDescription: This field label is inverted to make it meaningful to user. inactive is a negative word, but used internally to get false as a default.

dataElement.name: actionField
dataElement.label: Bulk action
dataElement.businessDescription: Used by grid panel to mark the operation to be carried out on the row. It is internally managed,and will not be visible to users any where

dataElement.name: filterField
dataElement.label: Filter
dataElement.businessDescription: Field that is used to get the value using which a field can be matched to filter rows

dataElement.name: liveWithErrors
dataElement.label: Do you want to live with errors in the project

dataElement.name: date
dataElement.businessDescription: Generic one for any temp
dataElement.label: Date

dataElement.name: yesNo
dataElement.businessDescription: Generic one for any temp
dataElement.label: What do you say?

dataElement.name: dateTime
dataElement.businessDescription: generic date with time field
dataElement.label: Date with Time

dataElement.name: severity
dataElement.label: Severity
dataElement.businessDescription: one of ignore, info, warning or error

dataElement.name: notificationId
dataElement.label: Internal Id
dataElement.businessDescription: Internally generated. Unique across all types of notifications

dataElement.name: requiresAction
dataElement.label: Requires Action
dataElement.businessDescription: Is it for the user to take some action

dataElement.name: possibleActions
dataElement.label: PossibleActions
dataElement.businessDescription: all the actions that the user can take on this item. Coded as actionName1=label1;actionName2=label2...

dataElement.name: documentType
dataElement.label: Document Type
dataElement.businessDescription: Document that the notification is about

dataGroup.name: resource
dataGroup.label: Resource
dataGroup.businessDescription: Used by pages that manage Exility resources.

dataElement.name: resourceType
dataElement.label: Resource type
dataElement.businessDescription: One of valid resource types like service,page etc..

dataElement.name: name
dataElement.label: Name
dataElement.businessDescription: name should be used only as a dataElement, and not directly used as a name of an element. 'name' is not a good name. Any name shoudl be qualified.

dataElement.name: tableType
dataElement.label: Table Type
dataElement.businessDescription: As defined in the data base. Either table or view.

dataElement.name: sqlDataType
dataElement.label: Data Type
dataElement.businessDescription: As defined in the db

dataElement.name: userId
dataElement.label: Internal Id
dataElement.businessDescription: Internally generated. User does not see this.

dataElement.name: workflowId
dataElement.label: Internal Id
dataElement.businessDescription: Internally generated. Unique across all workflows

dataElement.name: workflowName
dataElement.label: Workflow
dataElement.businessDescription: Name of the workflow definition, of which this is an instance

dataElement.name: linkedDocumentId
dataElement.label: Document Id
dataElement.businessDescription: Id of the document that is being oushed thru this workflow

dataElement.name: initiatorUserId
dataElement.label: Initiator User Id
dataElement.businessDescription: user id, internal one, of the user who initiated this workflow

dataElement.name: initiatorRoleId
dataElement.label: Initiator Role
dataElement.businessDescription: User-role assigmenet id under which the user initiated this workflow

dataElement.name: assignedRoles
dataElement.label: Assigned Roles
dataElement.businessDescription: This is an internal field that has all roles for which users are already assigned for this workflow. It is a comma separated list of assignments in the form roleName1=assignedRoleId1,roleName2=assignedRoleId2....

dataElement.name: userRoleId
dataElement.label: User Role
dataElement.businessDescription: User role that took this step

dataElement.name: workflowAction
dataElement.label: Action
dataElement.businessDescription: Action that resulted in this step

dataElement.name: toWorkflowState
dataElement.label: To State
dataElement.businessDescription: ending (new) state of the workflow

dataElement.name: fromWorkflowState
dataElement.label: From State
dataElement.businessDescription: Starting (current) state of the workflow

dataElement.name: userId
dataElement.label: User Id
dataElement.businessDescription: This is the niternal key

dataElement.name: loginId
dataElement.label: Login Id
dataElement.businessDescription: This is teh Id that the user uses to get into the system

dataElement.name: userNickName
dataElement.label: User
dataElement.businessDescription: Name as it shoudl be displayed

dataElement.name: userNickNameInLocalLanguage
dataElement.label: User
dataElement.businessDescription: Good to have this!!!

dataElement.name: roleId
dataElement.label: Role Id
dataElement.businessDescription: internal key

dataElement.name: roleName
dataElement.label: Role
dataElement.businessDescription: unique name of this role. Not visible to users. Users will see label.

dataElement.name: roleLabel
dataElement.label: Role Label
dataElement.businessDescription: Role as seen by end users

dataElement.name: reportingRoleId
dataElement.label: Reporting Role
dataElement.businessDescription: Role to which this role reports to. 0 if this is the top role.

dataElement.name: reportingRoleAssignmentId
dataElement.label: Reporting Role
dataElement.businessDescription: points to a key in the same tabale, except for role that do not report into any one else
